short_description: Using a Neural Network to predict output for testing data
long_description: Using a Neural Network to predict output for testing data

input_tables.name: testdata
input_tables.rDescription: Contains the data whose dependent values are to be predicted.
input_tables.description: Contains the data whose dependent values are to be predicted.

input_tables.name: modeldata
input_tables.rDescription: Contains a neural network weights model output by ta.neuralnet.
input_tables.description: Contains a neural network weights model output by NeuralNet.

argument_clauses.name: InputColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns of newdata that contain the numerical input predictor variables x1, x2, x3, etc.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns of testdata that contain the numerical input predictor variables x1, x2, x3, etc.

argument_clauses.name: GroupByColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the columns that are used to output different neural networks for different groups (should be in object, if specified).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the columns that are used to output different neural networks for different groups (should be in WeightsTable, if specified).

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns in the input_table that the function copies to linear_predictor_table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns in the input_table that the function copies to linear_predictor_table.

argument_clauses.name: HiddenLayers
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of hidden neurons in each layer, from left to right, by list of integers. Default value is 1 layer, 1 neuron.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of hidden neurons in each layer, from left to right, by list of integers. Default value is 1 layer, 1 neuron.

argument_clauses.name: ActivationFunction
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the differentiable function that is applied to the result of the cross-product of the neurons and the weights. Available choices are ‘logistic’ (default) and hyperbolic tangent (‘tanh’).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the differentiable function that is applied to the result of the cross-product of the neurons and the weights. Available choices are ‘logistic’ (default) and hyperbolic tangent (‘tanh’).

argument_clauses.name: LinearOutput
argument_clauses.rDescription: This logical value defines whether the activation.function should (FALSE) or should not (TRUE) be applied to the output neurons.
argument_clauses.description: This logical value defines whether the ActivationFunction should (FALSE) or should not (TRUE) be applied to the output neurons.

argument_clauses.name: NumOutputs
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of outputs from the neural net. Default value is 1. Maximum value is 1000.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of outputs from the neural net. Default value is 1. Maximum value is 1000.
